column24: Principle 1:  Relevance, impartiality and equal accessDoes your statistical legislation require official statistics to be compiled and published on an independent and impartial basis?
column25: Principle 2:  Professional standards and ethicsDoes your statistical legislation require reliable methods and procedures that are in accordance with scientific and professional standards by which official statistics are to be collected, processed, and stored?
column26: Principle 3: Accountability and transparencyDoes the statistical legislation contain provision(s) on how public statistics and methods are to be presented?
column27: Principle 4: Prevention of misuseDoes your statistical legislation entitle statistical agencies to flag misuse of statistics?
column28: Principle 5: Sources of official statisticsDoes your statistical legislation contain clear mandate for statistical agencies to collect data all kinds of sources according to established quality criteria?
column29: Principle 6: Confidentiality Does your statistical legislation impose that collected data is strictly confidential and will be used exclusively for statistical purposes?
column30: Principle 7: Legislation Is your statistical legislation publicly available?
column31: Principle 8: National Coordination Does your statistical legislation require coordination among statistical agencies within your country?
column32: Principle 9: Use of international standards Does your statistical legislation require the alignment of methods and classifications with international standards?
column33: Principle 10: International cooperationDoes your statistical legislation require/encourage the engagements in bilateral and multilateral cooperation in statistics?

column21: Annual plan of statistical surveys for 2024
column23: Articles 23 and 24 of the Law on Official Statistics and Official Statistical System (Official Gazette of Montenegro No 18/12 of 30 March 2012 and 47/19 of 12 August 2019) define the preparation of the Annual Plan of Official Statistics.For purpose of implementing the Programme, Annual Plan is adopted for every calendar year.  Other official statistics producers shall submit to the competent body proposals for compilation of the Annual Plan from their competence, no later than 10th June in a preceding year for which the Annual Plan is adopted.   The Annual Plan, upon prior opinion of the Council shall be passed by the Government.          The Annual Plan shall be passed no later than 1st December of current year for the following year.          The Annual Plan shall be published in the Official Gazette of Montenegro.    The Annual plan shall include:   1)      List of statistical surveys to be conducted; 2)     List of administrative sources and list of data obtained through continuous monitoring and observation method used in the official statistics; 3)      Development activities in accordance with the Programme; 4)      Funds required for the implementation of every statistical survey referred to in the Annual Plan.

column23: Statistics Poland considers the Statistical surveys programme of official statistics (PBSSP) as a the ‘national statistical plan’ / ‘statistical planning document’ mentioned in the questionnaire and our answers refer to the PBSSP. However, please note that the recent 3rd round of peer review in the European Statistical System on the degree of implementation of European Statistics Code of Practice in Poland resulted in a recommendation on: “Statistics Poland should establish a multi-annual strategic work plan to encompass directions, objectives and priorities in the longer term, as a framework for the implementation of the annual Statistical surveys programme of official statistics”. This recommendation would result in improvement action(s) elaborated by Statistics Poland. The work on them is currently in progress.
column35: In the 3rd round of European Statistical System peer review of the degree of implementation of European Statistics Code of Practice, Statistics Poland was found highly compliant with the ES CoP thus we consider being in compliance also with the 10 Principles of the FPOS as the ES CoP was elaborated based on and is in line with UN quality standard. The detailed report from our peer review exercise can be found at: Bulletin of Public Information / Activity of Official Statistics / Quality in statistics / Peer review / III round of Peer Review (https://bip.stat.gov.pl/en/activity-of-public-statistics/quality-in-statistics/peer-review/iii-peer-review/). Please also note that Statistics Poland recognizes the Act of 29 June 1995 on Official Statistics as Polish Commitment on Confidence in Statistics (required by EU legislation). More information can be found on Bulletin of Public Information / Law / Commitment on Confidence in Statistics (https://bip.stat.gov.pl/en/activity-of-public-statistics/quality-in-statistics/peer-review/iii-peer-review/) where extract from the provisions of the Act of 29 June 1995 on Official Statistics implementing the specific principles of the European Statistics Code of Practice (ES CoP) are enumerated.

column23: Our plan mostly digital transformation plan
column35: Israel’s Statistics Ordinance [New Version] complies with most of the Principles. It shall be noted that the Statistics Ordinance came into existence long before the digital revolution that made international comparisons a central part of the work in NSOs. In light of the changing technology and international demands,  the Israel Central Bureau of Statistics interprets Section 3(c) of the Ordinance (“The Statistician shall, in carrying out his functions, act on the basis of scientific principles”) to include the use of international standards (Principle 9). Thus we believe that the Ordinance is in compliance with principle 9. Regarding Principle 10 (International cooperation), while the Ordinance makes no explicit reference to it, such cooperation is implied according to the interpretation of Section 3(c) of the Ordinance. In practice, the Israel Central Bureau of Statistics complies with international standards and fully cooperates with the international organizations in carrying out their functions and duties. In doing so, the Israel Central Bureau of Statistics sees the use of “international standards” and “international cooperation” as among  its duties and functions according to its mandate under the Ordinance. To sum up, the Israel Central Bureau of Statistics interprets the Statistics Ordinance to mandate the use of international standards (Section 3(c)) and to mandate international cooperation (Section 3(c) and Section 18(b)(3)). This interpretation is acted upon in practice. Thus, we feel it is inaccurate to describe the Statistics Ordinance as not being in compliance with the Principles.

column35: Please be informed that the Statistics Act, Chapter 19.09 was incorporated into the laws of Guyana in 1965 (Act 14 of 1965) and the amended Bureau of Statistics Act 1991 (Act No. 25 of 1991) came into operation on 1st October, 1990. The UN Fundamental Principles of Official Statistics was adopted by the Statistical Commission in 1994 and endorsed by the General Assembly in 2014. While the Statistics Act does not specify all the requirements of the10 principles, it is noteworthy to mention that the Bureau of Statistics endeavors to operate within these guiding principles in achieving the mandate of the organization.

column35: El marco regulatorio de las estadísticas en Colombia esta elevado a categoría de Ley de la república.  La ley 2335 de 2023 por la cual se expiden las disposiciones sobre las estadísticas oficiales en el país, es el marco jurídico general para la planificación, producción, difusión y administración de las estadísticas oficiales de Colombia.  La ley estadística identifica los actores involucrados en la producción estadística de la nación y establece roles, funciones, responsabilidades claras y aplicables.  Es clara en señalar los requisitos para que la información sea parte de las estadísticas oficiales en el marco de la calidad de los datos.  Promueve la aplicación de un marco de aseguramiento de la calidad de las estadísticas y un marco de ética estadística que garantiza la integralidad, transparencia y confiabilidad de los datos.

column23: Le Mali a une longue expérience sur la stratégie Nationale de Développement de la Statistique depuis 2006. Nous sommes a notre 3ème SNDS et les dispositions sont en cours pour l'élaboration de 4ème devant couvrir 2025-2029. Nous avons manifesté l'intérêt pour l'assistance technique et financier de PARIS21 dans ce sens. Globalement la réalisation du SNDS2020-2024 est satisfaisant malgré les contextes nationaux et internationaux défavorables pendant sa mise en œuvre.
column35: La loi N°2016-005/ du 24 février 2016 qui régit l’activité statistique au Mali prévoit une gamme variée de principes qui sont en cohérence avec les principes édictées dans la Charte Africaine de la Statistique.  La nouvelle loi statistique (l'ancienne a été adoptée en 2005) institut l’obligation de réponse, garantit la confidentialité des données (protection des données individuelles) et encourage la coordination et la Coopération.

column23: ELSTAT approves every three years, by the end of March of the year preceding the year of its implementation, the Hellenic Statistical Program (ELSP), following the advisory opinion of the Advisory Committee of the Hellenic Statistical System (SY.EP.EL.S.S). The EL.S.P. sets out the major fields and objectives of the actions scheduled by EL.S.S. agencies for a three year period. ELSTAT, before the end of May of the year preceding the implementation year, and following the advisory opinion of SY.EP.EL.S.S., compiles its corresponding annual statistical work program.  The annual statistical work program of ELSTAT is posted on its website and includes, inter alia, the planning of statistical operations for the next year, the competent bodies for their conduct,  the general framework, aims, place and time of the surveys to be conducted, as well as the required human and financial resources for their conduct.

column23: Basados en las directrices emitidas por Paris 21, el INEC se encuentra formulando la Estrategia Nacional para el Desarrollo Estadístico con la participación del ecosistema de datos. A partir de la emisión y posterior implementación de este instrumento, se espera articular la planificación estadística nacional en el largo plazo.
column35: A fin de fortalecer el quehacer estadístico en Ecuador, considerando la vetustez de la Ley de Estadística vigente, en 2013 se emitió el Decreto Ejecutivo No. 77 que establece, entre otras cosas, el uso y aprovechamiento de fuentes de información complementarias como registros administrativos; la innovación en metodologías sobre levantamiento y análisis de información; y la emisión de normas y estándares que orienten y regulen la producción de estadística oficial de calidad. Asimismo, actualmente el Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos (INEC) se encuentra trabajando en la reforma de la Ley de Estadística, a la fecha cuenta con una propuesta generada por una consultoría especializada a nivel nacional que se encuentra en revisión y que, posteriormente, será elevada a otras instancias.

column23: DECREE OF THE PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF AZERBAIJAN ON  "Confirmation of the State Program on Improvement of the Official Statistics in the Republic of Azerbaijan in 2018-2025"        Following to Item 3 of Article109 of the Constitution of the Republic of Azerbaijan, in order to ensure improvement of official statistics in the country in line with international standards, enhancement of information provision for evaluation of the status of achieving goals and priorities of the Strategic Road Maps on National Economy Perspectives and Key Sectors of the Economy of the Republic of Azerbaijan confirmed by the Decree of the President of the Republic of Azerbaijan dated 6 December 2016, No.1138, expansion of administrative data usage and accelerating the reforms in the national statistical system, I hereby decide: To confirm "The State Program on Improvement of Official Statistics of the Republic of Azerbaijan in 2018-2025" (attached). to entrust the State Statistical Committee of the Republic of Azerbaijan: 2.1. to coordinate implementation of actions envisaged in the State Program approved by Part 1 of the Decree; 2.2. to report to the President of the Republic of Azerbaijan and to the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Azerbaijan about the course of the implementation of the actions envisaged in the State Program once a year. To entrust the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Azerbaijan to provide allocation of necessary funds while drafting the state budget every year in order to provide financing actions envisaged in the State Program that is approved by Part 1 of the Decree. To entrust the Cabinet of Ministers of the Republic of Azerbaijan to solve issues of the Decree. Baku, 14 February 2018 , № 3672, Ilham Aliyev President of the Republic of Azerbaijan

column23: Statistics Portugal activity is established by the Annual Work Programmes of Statistics Portugal and ONA (Other National Authorities) and follows the strategic guidance of the General Guidelines of Official Statistical Activity that cover a multiannual period (e.g. 2023-2027; 2018-2022) and are a strategic reference instrument of the National Statistical System, relevant to guide its activities, in the period under review, and also the European statistics programme.
column35: Official statistical activity in Portugal follows the relevant national and European legislation, most notably, the Law of the National Statistical System (Law no. 22/2022), Statistics Portugal's Organic Law (Decree-Law no. 136/2012) and Regulation (EC) no. 223/2009 on European Statistics, further developed in the European Statistics Code of Practice.

column21: (i) Strategic Plan Department of Statistics Malaysia 2021- 2025; (ii) Department of  Statistics Malaysia Transformation Plan 2015-2020; (iii) Strategic Plan Department of Statistics Malaysia 2010-2014
column23: The 2021-2025 Strategic Plan for the Department of Statistics Malaysia (DOSM) lays out a comprehensive roadmap comprising a core strategic, strategies, programs, activities, and direction. It was developed to reflect DOSM's pivotal role as the National Official Statistics Producer in shaping the nation's future and enhancing the well-being of the people. This plan is tailored to align with current government policies, stakeholder and user needs, as well as the evolving socio-economic landscape and challenges both domestically and globally. With its holistic approach, this strategic plan is designed to deliver statistical products and services that exceed user expectations.
column35: Under the "Statistics Act 1965 (Revised 1989)", DOSM’s main functions are (i) to collect and interpret statistics for the purpose of formulation or implementation of government policies in whatever fields as needed by the government or for fulfilling the requirements of trade, commerce, industry, agriculture or others; and (ii) to disseminate statistics which have been collected or interpretation based on statistics collected, not only to government agencies but also to authorities or persons where the information is useful to them.

column11: Instituto Nacional de Estadistica de Guinea Ecuatorial
column13: Yes, it complies with all principles
column23: La ENDE 2022-2026 de Guinea Ecuatorial es el documento que desarrolla la política estadística nacional a implementar en el periodo 2022 - 2026, en él se desarrollan las acciones que se implementarán a corto y mediano plazo, para atender las necesidades estadísticas que adolece el país y lograr el fortalecimiento y modernización del Sistema Estadístico Nacional (SEN), a fin de que éste sea capaz de generar estadísticas oficiales fiables, y de calidad en el tiempo oportuno. Está alineada a la Estrategia para la Armonización de las Estadísticas en África (SHaSA 2). Fue validada por el Comité de Programas Estadísticos y por el Consejo nacional de Estadística, en ultima instancia, fue adoptada por el Gobierno mediante el Decreto Núm.. 103/2023 de fecha 17 de julio, por el que se adopta la ENDE 2022-2026.
column35: la Ley N° 3/2020, de fecha 16 de octubre, Reguladora de la Actividad  Estadística en Guinea Ecuatorial fue elaborada para responder a las nuevas necesidades del SEN y para armonizar el marco legal estadístico nacional con los Principios Fundamentales de las Estadísticas Oficiales de Naciones Unidas y con la Carta Africana de Estadística.

column21: Tanzania Statistical Master Plan Phase Two (TSMP II) 2022/23 – 2026/27
column23: The second five- year Tanzania Statistical Master Plan (TSMP II) is a follow up of TSMPI which was implemented between 2011/2012 -2017/2018. TSMP II will be implemented under coordination of NBS and OCGS to provide the necessary common statistical framework to re-focus and induce rapid statistical growth towards strengthening the administrative statistics of the Ministries, Department and Agency (MDAs); Local Government Authorities (LGAs); as well as Non-State Actors (NSAs) of both Tanzania Mainland and Zanzibar.
column35: The Statistics Act is among the legislation that have been revised in 2019 and published on 28th February, 2020 (GN 140/2020). The said revision of the Statistics Act includes the amendments of  2018 and 2019.  In this regard, with effect from 28th February 2020, the Statistics Act shall be cited as “The Statistics Act, [Cap 351 R.E 2019].
